intro: Tolumnia × ann-hadderae, commonly known as the hybrid hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Tolumnia annua and Tolumnia hadderae, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, depending on the climate, and features hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and are pollinated by insects, making it an attractive addition to gardens. Tolumnia × ann-hadderae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
